revised_title: Regulation of Intracellular Algae Numbers in Aquatic Invertebrates
tldr: This article discusses the regulation of numbers of intracellular algae in aquatic invertebrates, focusing on three possible mechanisms: expulsion of excess cells, inhibition of algal growth by the host, and digestion of algal symbionts. The study examines various algae-invertebrate associations, including Hydra viridis and Paramecium bursaria with Chlorella sp., and Anthozoa with symbiotic dinoflagellates, to understand the cellular interactions and stability of these associations.
